name: Dengue Fever
symptoms: High fever, Severe headache, Joint pain, Rash, Fatigue
cause: Dengue virus, Transmitted via Aedes mosquito bites
precautions: Use mosquito repellents, Wear long sleeves, Eliminate standing water, Use bed nets

drug_descriptions.Paracetamol: For fever and pain relief, 500-1000 mg every 4-6 hours. May cause liver toxicity in overdose.
drug_descriptions.Fluids: Oral or IV rehydration to prevent dehydration. No significant side effects.
drug_descriptions.No specific antiviral: No antiviral drug exists; supportive care is key.

description: A viral infection causing flu-like symptoms, potentially leading to severe complications like hemorrhagic fever.

name: Crohn’s Disease
symptoms: Abdominal pain, Diarrhea, Weight loss, Fatigue, Fever
cause: Autoimmune response, Genetic factors, Gut bacteria imbalance
precautions: Avoid trigger foods, Manage stress, Regular check-ups, Maintain nutrition

drug_descriptions.Mesalamine: Anti-inflammatory for gut, 2-4 g daily. May cause nausea.
drug_descriptions.Adalimumab: Biologic for inflammation, 40 mg every other week. May cause injection site reactions.
drug_descriptions.Prednisone: Corticosteroid, 20-40 mg daily, tapered. May cause weight gain.

description: A chronic inflammatory bowel disease affecting the digestive tract, causing persistent discomfort.

name: Shingles
symptoms: Painful rash, Blisters, Itching, Fever, Sensitivity to touch
cause: Varicella-zoster virus, Reactivation from prior chickenpox
precautions: Get vaccinated, Avoid contact with rash, Maintain immune health, Avoid stress

drug_descriptions.Acyclovir: Antiviral, 800 mg 5 times daily for 7-10 days. May cause nausea.
drug_descriptions.Valacyclovir: Antiviral, 1 g three times daily for 7 days. May cause headache.
drug_descriptions.Gabapentin: For nerve pain, 300-600 mg daily. May cause dizziness.

description: A viral infection causing a painful rash, often in older adults or those with weakened immunity.

name: Otitis Media
symptoms: Ear pain, Fever, Hearing loss, Irritability, Fluid drainage
cause: Bacterial or viral infections, Often following colds
precautions: Avoid water in ears, Vaccinate against flu, Maintain hygiene, Avoid smoke exposure

drug_descriptions.Amoxicillin: Antibiotic, 500 mg every 8 hours for 7-10 days. May cause diarrhea.
drug_descriptions.Ibuprofen: For pain, 400-800 mg every 6 hours. May cause stomach upset.
drug_descriptions.Ear drops: Antibiotic/steroid drops, 2-3 drops 3 times daily. May cause local irritation.

description: An infection of the middle ear, common in children, causing pain and potential hearing issues.

name: Hypertension
symptoms: Headache, Dizziness, Chest pain, Shortness of breath, Nosebleeds
cause: Genetic factors, Stress, Obesity, High salt intake
precautions: Reduce salt, Exercise regularly, Manage stress, Monitor blood pressure

drug_descriptions.Lisinopril: ACE inhibitor, 10-40 mg daily. May cause cough.
drug_descriptions.Amlodipine: Calcium channel blocker, 5-10 mg daily. May cause swelling.
drug_descriptions.Hydrochlorothiazide: Diuretic, 12.5-25 mg daily. May cause electrolyte imbalance.

description: Chronic high blood pressure, increasing the risk of heart disease and stroke.

name: Cholera
symptoms: Severe diarrhea, Vomiting, Dehydration, Muscle cramps, Shock
cause: Vibrio cholerae, Contaminated water or food
precautions: Drink clean water, Proper sanitation, Cook food thoroughly, Vaccinate

drug_descriptions.Doxycycline: Antibiotic, 300 mg single dose. May cause photosensitivity.
drug_descriptions.Fluids: Oral or IV rehydration, dose varies. No significant side effects.
drug_descriptions.Azithromycin: Antibiotic, 1 g single dose. May cause diarrhea.

description: A bacterial infection causing severe watery diarrhea, often in areas with poor sanitation.

name: Lupus
symptoms: Joint pain, Rash, Fatigue, Fever, Kidney issues
cause: Autoimmune response, Genetic factors, Environmental triggers
precautions: Avoid sun exposure, Manage stress, Regular check-ups, Healthy diet

drug_descriptions.Hydroxychloroquine: For symptom control, 200-400 mg daily. May cause vision changes.
drug_descriptions.Prednisone: Corticosteroid, 5-60 mg daily. May cause weight gain.
drug_descriptions.Mycophenolate: Immunosuppressant, 1-3 g daily. May cause gastrointestinal upset.

description: A systemic autoimmune disease affecting multiple organs, often with flare-ups.

name: Tetanus
symptoms: Muscle stiffness, Spasms, Fever, Jaw locking, Sweating
cause: Clostridium tetani, Enters via wounds
precautions: Get vaccinated, Clean wounds thoroughly, Avoid rusty objects, Use protective gear

drug_descriptions.Tetanus immunoglobulin: Neutralizes toxin, dose varies. May cause injection site pain.
drug_descriptions.Metronidazole: Antibiotic, 500 mg every 8 hours. May cause nausea.
drug_descriptions.Diazepam: For muscle spasms, 5-10 mg every 4-6 hours. May cause drowsiness.

description: A bacterial infection causing muscle spasms, often due to contaminated wounds.

name: Gout
symptoms: Sudden joint pain, Swelling, Redness, Heat, Stiffness
cause: Uric acid buildup, Diet, Genetic factors
precautions: Limit purine-rich foods, Stay hydrated, Maintain healthy weight, Avoid alcohol

drug_descriptions.Allopurinol: Reduces uric acid, 100-300 mg daily. May cause rash.
drug_descriptions.Colchicine: For acute attacks, 0.6 mg every 1-2 hours. May cause diarrhea.
drug_descriptions.Ibuprofen: For pain, 400-800 mg every 6 hours. May cause stomach upset.

description: A form of arthritis caused by uric acid crystals, leading to intense joint pain.

name: Pneumococcal Pneumonia
symptoms: Fever, Cough, Chest pain, Shortness of breath, Confusion
cause: Streptococcus pneumoniae, Airborne or direct contact
precautions: Get vaccinated, Avoid crowds, Maintain hygiene, Stop smoking

drug_descriptions.Levofloxacin: Antibiotic, 750 mg daily for 5-7 days. May cause tendon issues.
drug_descriptions.Ceftriaxone: Antibiotic, 1-2 g daily. May cause rash.
drug_descriptions.Azithromycin: Antibiotic, 500 mg day 1, then 250 mg daily for 4 days. May cause diarrhea.

description: A bacterial lung infection causing severe respiratory symptoms, often in the elderly.

name: Rosacea
symptoms: Facial redness, Bumps, Eye irritation, Flushing, Visible blood vessels
cause: Genetic factors, Environmental triggers, Demodex mites
precautions: Avoid spicy foods, Use sunscreen, Manage stress, Use gentle skincare

drug_descriptions.Metronidazole: Topical for inflammation, applied twice daily. May cause skin irritation.
drug_descriptions.Doxycycline: Oral antibiotic, 40 mg daily. May cause photosensitivity.
drug_descriptions.Ivermectin: Topical for mites, applied once daily. May cause burning.

description: A chronic skin condition causing facial redness and inflammation, often triggered by external factors.

name: Hepatitis C
symptoms: Fatigue, Jaundice, Abdominal pain, Nausea, Joint pain
cause: Hepatitis C virus, Bloodborne transmission
precautions: Avoid sharing needles, Screen blood products, Practice safe sex, Regular testing

drug_descriptions.Sofosbuvir: Antiviral, 400 mg daily for 12 weeks. May cause fatigue.
drug_descriptions.Ledipasvir: Combined with sofosbuvir, 90 mg daily. May cause headache.
drug_descriptions.Ribavirin: Antiviral, 1000-1200 mg daily. May cause anemia.

description: A viral liver infection, often chronic, potentially leading to cirrhosis.

name: Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease
symptoms: Chronic cough, Shortness of breath, Wheezing, Chest tightness, Fatigue
cause: Smoking, Air pollution, Genetic factors
precautions: Quit smoking, Avoid pollutants, Use inhalers, Exercise regularly

drug_descriptions.Tiotropium: Bronchodilator, 18 mcg daily. May cause dry mouth.
drug_descriptions.Salmeterol: Long-acting bronchodilator, 50 mcg twice daily. May cause palpitations.
drug_descriptions.Prednisone: For exacerbations, 40 mg daily for 5 days. May cause weight gain.

description: A progressive lung disease causing breathing difficulties, often linked to smoking.

name: Giardiasis
symptoms: Diarrhea, Abdominal cramps, Bloating, Fatigue, Weight loss
cause: Giardia lamblia, Contaminated water or food
precautions: Drink clean water, Wash hands, Cook food thoroughly, Avoid untreated water

drug_descriptions.Metronidazole: Antiparasitic, 500 mg three times daily for 5-7 days. May cause nausea.
drug_descriptions.Tinidazole: Antiparasitic, 2 g single dose. May cause metallic taste.
drug_descriptions.Nitazoxanide: Antiparasitic, 500 mg twice daily for 3 days. May cause abdominal pain.

description: A parasitic infection of the intestines, causing digestive symptoms, often from contaminated sources.

name: Endometriosis
symptoms: Pelvic pain, Painful periods, Infertility, Fatigue, Heavy bleeding
cause: Endometrial tissue growth outside uterus, Hormonal factors
precautions: Regular check-ups, Manage pain, Healthy diet, Consider hormonal therapy

drug_descriptions.Ibuprofen: For pain, 400-800 mg every 6 hours. May cause stomach upset.
drug_descriptions.Leuprolide: Hormonal therapy, 3.75 mg monthly. May cause hot flashes.
drug_descriptions.Norethindrone: Progestin, 5 mg daily. May cause mood changes.

description: A condition where uterine tissue grows outside the uterus, causing pain and fertility issues.

name: Rabies
symptoms: Fever, Headache, Muscle spasms, Confusion, Hydrophobia
cause: Rabies virus, Transmitted via animal bites
precautions: Vaccinate pets, Avoid wild animals, Seek immediate treatment post-bite, Use protective gear

drug_descriptions.Rabies vaccine: Post-exposure prophylaxis, 4 doses over 14 days. May cause injection site pain.
drug_descriptions.Rabies immunoglobulin: Neutralizes virus, dose varies. May cause local reactions.
drug_descriptions.Diazepam: For spasms, 5-10 mg every 4-6 hours. May cause drowsiness.

description: A fatal viral infection affecting the nervous system, transmitted through animal bites.

name: Osteoarthritis
symptoms: Joint pain, Stiffness, Swelling, Reduced mobility, Crepitus
cause: Cartilage degeneration, Aging, Obesity, Joint injury
precautions: Maintain healthy weight, Exercise regularly, Avoid joint stress, Use supportive devices

drug_descriptions.Acetaminophen: For pain, 500-1000 mg every 4-6 hours. May cause liver toxicity.
drug_descriptions.Duloxetine: For chronic pain, 60 mg daily. May cause nausea.
drug_descriptions.Hyaluronic acid: Intra-articular injection, dose varies. May cause joint swelling.

description: A degenerative joint disease causing cartilage breakdown and pain, often in older adults.

name: Typhoid Fever
symptoms: High fever, Weakness, Abdominal pain, Rash, Constipation
cause: Salmonella typhi, Contaminated food or water
precautions: Drink clean water, Vaccinate, Maintain hygiene, Cook food thoroughly

drug_descriptions.Ceftriaxone: Antibiotic, 1-2 g daily for 7-14 days. May cause rash.
drug_descriptions.Azithromycin: Antibiotic, 500 mg daily for 7 days. May cause diarrhea.
drug_descriptions.Chloramphenicol: Antibiotic, 500 mg every 6 hours. May cause bone marrow suppression.

description: A bacterial infection causing prolonged fever and systemic symptoms, often in endemic areas.

name: Allergic Rhinitis
symptoms: Sneezing, Runny nose, Itchy eyes, Nasal congestion, Throat irritation
cause: Allergens like pollen, Dust mites, Pet dander
precautions: Avoid allergens, Use air purifiers, Keep windows closed, Use nasal saline

drug_descriptions.Cetirizine: Antihistamine, 10 mg daily. May cause drowsiness.
drug_descriptions.Fluticasone: Nasal corticosteroid, 1-2 sprays daily. May cause nosebleeds.
drug_descriptions.Montelukast: For allergy control, 10 mg daily. May cause headache.

description: An allergic reaction causing nasal and eye symptoms, often seasonal or environmental.

name: Sepsis
symptoms: Fever, Rapid heart rate, Confusion, Low blood pressure, Shortness of breath
cause: Bacterial, viral, or fungal infections, Immune overreaction
precautions: Treat infections promptly, Maintain hygiene, Vaccinate, Monitor symptoms

drug_descriptions.Ceftriaxone: Broad-spectrum antibiotic, 1-2 g daily. May cause rash.
drug_descriptions.Vancomycin: For resistant bacteria, 15-20 mg/kg every 8-12 hours. May cause kidney issues.
drug_descriptions.Norepinephrine: For blood pressure support, dose varies. May cause arrhythmias.

description: A life-threatening condition caused by the body’s extreme response to infection, requiring urgent care.
